poem:
A Fall in Hackney

She reached, a mend of hands,  
to the sky that listens,  
holding her space, frail  
on the wooden perch, she  
whispered prayers to pipes.  
Below, the earth waited;  
gravity sang its hymn,  
a harsh descent. Above,  
London clouds watched,  
cursing the tape that failed  
to bind her to tomorrow.
